channel.title: mixture models on Diana R. Cai
channel.description: Recent content in mixture models on Diana R. Cai

item.title: Finite mixture models do not reliably learn the number of components
item.description: Preliminary versions appeared in NeurIPS 2019 Workshop on Machine Learning with Guarantees and also the Symposium on Advances in Approximate Bayesian Inference 2017, co-located with NeurIPS 2017. Citation @InProceedings{pmlr-v139-cai21a, title = {Finite mixture models do not reliably learn the number of components}, author = {Cai, Diana and Campbell, Trevor and Broderick, Tamara}, booktitle = {Proceedings of the 38th International Conference on Machine Learning}, pages = {1158--1169}, year = {2021}, volume = {139}, series = {Proceedings of Machine Learning Research}, publisher = {PMLR} }

item.title: Power posteriors do not reliably learn the number of components in a finite mixture
item.description: See also: Finite mixture models do not reliably learn the number of components (arXiv e-print 2007.04470) for results on learning the number of components in a finite mixture model via the usual posterior distribution.

item.title: Priors on exchangeable directed graphs
item.description: Directed graphs occur throughout statistical modeling of networks, and exchangeability is a natural assumption when the ordering of vertices does not matter. There is a deep structural theory for exchangeable undirected graphs, which extends to the directed case via measurable objects known as digraphons …
